intro: Santia maritima, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its spiny, blue or purple flowers and silver-gray leaves that reflect sunlight. The plant thrives in salty, well-drained soils and is often found in dunes and rocky coastlines. Santia maritima is a perennial herb that produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Its unique appearance and adaptability to harsh coastal environments make it an important part of maritime ecosystems.
